title: Introduction to Thermodynamics and Heat Transfer
description: Macroscopic approach to energy analysis. Energy transfer as work and heat, and the First Law of thermodynamics. Properties and states of simple substances. Control-mass and control-volume analysis. The essence of entropy, and the Second Law of thermodynamics. The Carnot cycle and its implications for practical cyclic devices. Introduction to heat transfer by conduction, convection, and radiation. Basic formulation and solution of steady and transient problems. Issues relevant to the cooling of electrical devices.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: MTE 202, 203; Level at least 3A Mechatronics Engineering. Antireq: SYDE 381

title: Algorithms and Data Structures
description: This course emphasizes the following topics: structured software design data structures, abstract data types, recursive algorithms, algorithm analysis and design, sorting and searching, hashing, and problem-solving strategies.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: ECE 150 or MTE 121/GENE 121; Level at least 1B Mechatronics Engineering. Antireq: CS 240/240E, ECE 250 and SYDE 223

title: Introduction to Computer Structures and Real-Time Systems
description: Introduction to computer organization, basic real-time concepts, process management, interprocess communication and synchronization, memory management, resource management, interrupt handling, concurrent programming, file systems.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: MTE 121/GENE 121 and MTE 140; Level at least 2B Mechatronics Engineering students. Antireq: ECE 254

title: Microprocessor Systems and Interfacing for Mechatronics Engineering
description:
Synchronization and data flow; interfacing to sensors and actuators;
parallel, serial, and analog interfacing; buses; direct memory access (DMA); interfacing considerations; privacy and security considerations. [Offered: W,S]
requirementsDescription: Prereq: ME 262 or MTE 262; Level at least 3A Mechatronics Engineering

title: Advanced Calculus
description: Review of vectors and vector operations; 3-D analytic geometry and space curves; multivariable calculus, including partial differentiation, total differential, chain rule, directional derivative, gradient operator, maxima and minima; multiple integrals - surface area, volume, and moments of inertia; line and surface integrals; vector theorems; complex analysis including limits, analytic functions, complex line integral, Cauchy's Integral Formula; Fourier Series (real and complex) and Fourier Integrals.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: MATH 118; Level at least 2B Mechatronics Engineering. Antireq: ME 201

title: Numerical Methods
description: Number systems and machine errors; roots of non-linear equations; matrix calculations; Eigenvalue and Eigenvector calculations; interpolation and approximation; numerical integration and solution of ODE's (linear and non-linear) and systems of ODEs; calculation of series; solution methods for PDE's; use of numeric and symbolic computing tools.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: MTE 202; Level at least 2B Mechatronics Engineering.

title: Structure and Properties of Materials
description: The relevance of materials to engineering practice; the relationships between macroscopic physical properties (including mechanical, photonic, thermal, electrical, and magnetic properties) and microscopic causes based on fundamental principles (including electronic and atomic structures, atomic bonding, crystal structure, and microstructure); description of the differences in macroscopic physical properties of metals, polymers, ceramics, semiconductors, and composite materials in terms of microscopic causes.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 1B Mechatronics Engineering, CHE 102. Antireq: ME 115

title: Statics
description: Basic concepts of mechanics, vectors. Statics of particles. Rigid bodies and force systems, equilibrium of rigid bodies. Analysis of trusses and frames. Distributed forces, centroids, and moments of inertia. Friction. Internal shear and bending moments in beams.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 1B Mechatronics Engineering. Antireq: CIVE 105, SYDE 181

title: Circuits
description: Basic electromagnetic theory; magnetic circuits; electric circuit elements; DC circuit analysis; first-order transient response; AC circuit analysis. [Offered: W,S]
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 1B Mechatronics Engineering. Antireq: ECE 140, GENE 123

title: Sensors and Instrumentation
description: Review of circuit theory; input-output relationships, transfer functions and frequency response of linear systems; operational amplifiers, operational amplifier circuits using negative or positive feedback; diodes, operational amplifier circuits using diodes; analog signal detection, conditioning and conversion systems; transducers and sensors, difference and instrumentation amplifiers, active filters.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: MTE 120, 201; Level at least 2B Mechatronics Engineering. Coreq: SYDE 252. Antireq: SYDE 292

title: Actuators and Power Electronics
description: Review of circuit analysis and basic electromagnetic theory. Power electronics: power electronics circuits, H bridges, PWM control, interfacing, power amplifiers. DC servo and stepper motors, AC synchronous and induction motors. Transformers. Introduction to typical speed and torque control techniques of motors.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: MTE 120; Level at least 3A Mechatronics Engineering. Antireq: ME 269

title: Seminar
description: Discussion of structure of mechatronics engineering curriculum, operation of department, faculty, university, technical societies.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 1B Mechatronics Engineering

title: Seminar
description: Discussion of the structure of and options within the mechatronics engineering curriculum; of the operation of department, faculty, university, technical societies; of student team and graduate school opportunities; of safety training; and of subject material in support of core courses.

title: Seminar
description: Discussion of the structure of and options within the mechatronics engineering curriculum; of the operation of department, faculty, university, technical societies; of student team and graduate school opportunities; of safety training; and of subject material in support of core courses.

title: Design and Dynamics of Machines
description: Principles of the geometry and motion in linkages and mechanisms. Computer-aided kinematic and kinetic analysis of mechanisms. Synthesis of mechanisms. Static failure and yield criteria in ductile and brittle materials. Fatigue failure criteria due to fluctuating stresses. Shaft design under static and fluctuating loads. Shaft components, including shoulders, keys, and keyways. Deflections in shafts.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: MTE 203, 219, SYDE 182; Level at least 3A Mechatronics Engineering. Antireq: ME 321

title: Systems Models 1
description: Introduction to systems modelling and analysis. Graph theoretic models and formulation of system equations. State space formulation and solution. Time and frequency domain solution. Application to engineering systems.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 3A Mechanical Engineering. Antireq: SYDE 351

title: Linear Systems and Signals
description: Models and analysis of linear systems. Discrete time systems, continuous time systems; difference and differential equations; impulse and frequency response. Complex frequency, functions of complex variable transform domain techniques: Z transforms; Fourier analysis, Laplace transform. Transfer functions and frequency response, frequency domain analysis of linear systems; sample theory, stability, and linear filters.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Level at least 2B Mechatronics Engineering or 2B Mechanical Engineering. Antireq: BME 252, SYDE 252
